comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: That hair on the plate is likely to derail the train as it passes!  Nice shot of the typical small railway station of that era.  Those were some of the early diesel railcars in operation at that time.  H&J is just a few miles from Thurles but I am sure they missed their train service all the same.

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: A lovely one that is, taken from the signal cabin. The diesel railcar is operating the twice daily Clonmel-Thurles service. That bridge in the background carried the old Dublin-Cork road. Although closed in 1963, the line remained open for goods until 1968, and then subsequently lifted in 1970/1.
